content:
To get an appointment at the Egyptian Consulate General in Frankfurt to issue a Power of Attorney for a German person to an Egyptian, follow these steps:

1. Gather necessary documentation: Before contacting the consulate, ensure you have all the required documents for the Power of Attorney. This usually includes personal identification documents for both the German and Egyptian individuals involved, as well as any specific documents related to the matter for which the Power of Attorney is being issued.
2. Visit the consulate's website: Go to the official website of the Egyptian Consulate General in Frankfurt (as of my knowledge cutoff in 2021, it was <https://www.egyptconsulateffm.de/> - please verify the current website). Look for information regarding consular services and Power of Attorney procedures.
3. Contact the consulate: Reach out to the consulate via phone, email, or the contact form on their website to inquire about the process and request an appointment. Make sure to provide your name, contact information, and a brief description of the purpose of your appointment. Here is the contact information as of September 2021 (please verify the current contact details):
* Phone: +49 (0) 69 660 539 0
* Email: [info@egyptconsulateffm.de](mailto:info@egyptconsulateffm.de)
1. Wait for confirmation: The consulate should provide you with a date and time for your appointment, along with any additional instructions or requirements.
2. Prepare for your appointment: Make sure you have all the required documents ready for your appointment. You may need to have some documents translated into Arabic, as the Power of Attorney may need to be issued in both German and Arabic. Additionally, verify the fees associated with the issuance of the Power of Attorney and bring the necessary payment (in the accepted form) to the appointment.
3. Attend the appointment: Go to the consulate on the scheduled date and time, and follow their instructions to complete the process.

Remember that consulate procedures and requirements may change over time, so it's essential to verify the information with the consulate directly.
